column1: > 12:00|"Shortly after midday"|"“There is. Shortly after midday gong the guards took the off-worlder
column3: to answer the claims of Othelm
column4: the beast dealer. And the party were set upon by mounted men from beyond the boundary. When the skirmish was over the off-worlder was gone. It is believed that he is back with his kin
column5: and the chief priest has ordered their trade booth closed and the Traders to remove themselves.”"|"Moon of Three Rings"|"Andre Norton"

column2: meeting with none other on the outward road from Yrjar than some belated fairgoers. And to the greetings of these I replied as one who had cares
column3: twice saying that illness among my beasts drove me to this departure. But after midday I turned from the open road into a side trail which still led eastward
column4: lest some passer-by would begin to wonder why I needs must go so far in my search for peace and quiet for my ill ones."|"Moon of Three Rings"|"Andre Norton"

column1: ap 02:00|two|"Stand up—1 wanted to stand up. I wavered
column2: staggered. To rise to four feet was not the same as standing upon two. I lifted my head. Scents
column3: my nose drowned in scents; so thickly did they assault my nostrils that it was as if all possible odors had been sprayed into one ship’s cabin and I was locked therein. I choked
column4: thought that I could not breathe. But I did and the scents began to carry messages which I only partially understood. I tried to creep as a man would go on all fours
column5: and tottered a step or two. The animal that had licked my head shouldered against me in support until I managed to stand without wavering. To look about me from this new angle was another thing to be learned
column6: and I had by no means mastered it when there was a disturbance behind me."|"Moon of Three Rings"|"Andre Norton"

column1: 12:00|midday|"“I will. Now let us consider what lies before us
column2: not what may exist behind a mountain range or two. By midday we shall arrive at Yim-Sin
column3: the road to it lies there—” We were coming down a bank to a road into which the kasi turned
column4: heading upward from the plains."|"Moon of Three Rings"|"Andre Norton"

column1: 00:00|midnight|"By midnight I found a pass which was no more than a knife edge of crevice
column2: and was on the down slope to the plains. But fatigue drove me into hiding and the sleep I must have."|"Moon of Three Rings"|"Andre Norton"

column1: < 12:00|"almost noon"|"It had been almost noon when Malec had been struck down. With the best of success
column2: I did not believe we could expect Maelen to return before two days passed
column3: And I hoped those setting the trap in camp would grow discouraged before the end of that time. The strategy I had used to take the animals out of danger would be successful
column4: unless they lost patience and returned."|"Moon of Three Rings"|"Andre Norton"

column1: 12:00|midday|"I judged it midday when we came out into the courtyard of the temple. There was no sign of the van
column2: but two riding kasi awaited us
column3: journey cloaks across their saddle pads
column4: bundles of provisions hanging ready. I would have aided Maelen to mount
column5: but she was too quick for me
column6: and I went to my own kas. Could it be she shrank from any contact in aversion?"|"Moon of Three Rings"|"Andre Norton"
